models¶

Module for skill models @author Siddharth Reddy <sgr45@cornell.edu> 01/07/15

class models.AssessmentBiasedCoinModel(history, filtered_history=None)¶

Class for simple skill model where assessments are modeled as biased coins that flip to pass/fail students

assessment_outcome_log_likelihood(interaction, outcome=None)¶

Compute log-likelihood of assessment interaction, given assessment pass rate

Parameters:
  • interaction (dict) – An interaction
  • outcome (bool|None) –

If outcome is a bool, it overrides interaction[‘outcome’]. This is useful for SkillModel.assessment_pass_likelihood

Return type:float
Returns:Log-likelihood of assessment result, given assessment pass rate
fit()¶

Estimate pass likelihood for each assessment

Uses Laplace smoothing

class models.EmbeddingModel(history, embedding_dimension=2, graph=None, using_lessons=True, using_prereqs=True, using_bias=True, using_graph_prior=False, graph_regularization_constant=0.1, tv_luv_model=None, forgetting_model=None, learning_update_variance_constant=0.5, forgetting_penalty_term_constant=0.0, anti_singularity_lower_bound=0.1)¶

Class for a Latent Skill Embedding model that embeds students, assessments, and lessons in a joint semantic space that allows us to reason about relationships between students and content (i.e., assessment result likelihoods and knowledge gains from lessons)

assessment_outcome_log_likelihood(interaction, outcome=None)¶

Compute log-likelihood of assessment interaction given the embedding

Parameters:
  • object] interaction (dict[str,) – An interaction
  • outcome (bool|None) – If outcome is a bool, it overrides interaction[‘outcome’]. This is useful for SkillModel.assessment_pass_likelihood
Return type:

float|np.nan
Returns:

Log-likelihood of outcome, given the embedding.

If computing the log-likelihood results in a numerical error (e.g., overflow or underflow), then np.nan is returned.

concept_assessment_edges_in_graph()¶

Get a list of concept-assessment edges in the graph

Return type:(np.array, np.array, int, int, np.array)
Returns:A tuple of (assessment indexes, concept indexes, number of unique assessments, number of unique concepts, number of concepts for each assessment in the first array of this tuple)
concept_lesson_edges_in_graph()¶

Get a list of concept-lesson edges in the graph

Return type:(np.array, np.array, int, int, np.array)
Returns:A tuple of (lesson indexes, concept indexes, number of unique lessons, number of unique concepts, number of concepts for each lesson in the first array of this tuple)
embedding_distance(student_embedding, module_embedding)¶

Compute the distance between a student and an assessment (or prereq) in the latent skill space

dist(s, a) = (s dot a) / ||a|| - ||a||

Parameters:
  • student_embedding (np.ndarray) – A student embedding
  • module_embedding (np.ndarray) – An assessment (or prereq) embedding
Return type:

float
Returns:

Distance in the latent skill space
fit(estimator)¶

Fit skill embedding model to its interaction history

Parameters:estimator (est.EmbeddingModelEstimator) – A skill embedding model estimator
forgetting_penalty_terms(times_since_prev_ixn_for_lesson_ixns)¶

Compute forgetting penalties of Gaussian learning updates

Parameters:times_since_prev_ixn_for_lesson_ixns (np.array) – Time since previous interaction (for each lesson interaction)
Return type:np.ndarray
Returns:A two-dimensional array with shape (num_lesson_interactions, embedding_dimension) containing the forgetting penalty term for each lesson interaction
learning_update_variance(times_since_prev_ixn_for_lesson_ixns)¶

Compute variances of Gaussian learning updates

Parameters:times_since_prev_ixn_for_lesson_ixns (np.array) – Time since previous interaction, for each lesson interaction
Return type:np.ndarray
Returns:A column vector of variances, one for each lesson interaction
class models.IRTModel(history, filtered_history=None, select_regularization_constant=False)¶

Class for one-parameter logistic item response theory (1PL IRT) model of binary response correctness

assessment_outcome_log_likelihood(interaction, outcome=None)¶

Compute the log-likelihood of an assessment outcome, given trained model parameters

Parameters:
  • object] interaction (dict[str,) – A single interaction
  • outcome (bool|None) – If not None, then overrides interaction[‘outcome’]

:rtype float :return Log-likelihood of outcome that occurred, under the model

assessment_pass_likelihoods(df)¶

Compute pass likelihoods of a set of assessments, given trained model parameters

Parameters:df (pd.DataFrame) – A set of assessment interactions

:rtype list[float] :return A list of pass likelihoods

feature_matrix_from_interactions(df)¶

Construct sparse feature matrix for a set of assessment interactions

Parameters:df (pd.DataFrame) – A set of assessment interactions

:rtype scipy.sparse.csr_matrix :return A sparse array of dimensions [n_samples] X [n_features]

fit()¶

Estimate model parameters that fit the interaction history in self.history

class models.OneParameterLogisticModel(history, filtered_history=None, select_regularization_constant=False)¶

Class for one-parameter logistic item response theory (1PL IRT) model of binary response correctness

feature_matrix_from_interactions(df)¶

Construct sparse feature matrix for a set of assessment interactions

The feature vector for an interaction is a binary vector with values for each student (proficiency) and each assessment (difficulty)

Parameters:df (pd.DataFrame) – A set of assessment interactions

:rtype scipy.sparse.csr_matrix :return A sparse array of dimensions [n_samples] X [n_features]

class models.SkillModel¶

Superclass for skill models. A skill model is an object that ingests an interaction history, then learns a representation of students and content that can be used to predict unobserved assessment outcomes.

The abstract method assessment_outcome_log_likelihood should output the log-likelihood of an assessment outcome given the skill model’s parameterizations of the student and assessment.

assessment_outcome_log_likelihood(interaction, outcome=None)¶

Compute log-likelihood of assessment outcome

Parameters:
  • object] interaction (dict[str,) – An interaction
  • outcome (bool|None) – An assessment result
Return type:

float
Returns:

Log-likelihood of outcome, given student and content parameters
assessment_pass_likelihood(interaction)¶

Compute the likelihood of passing an assessment interaction

Parameters:object] interaction (dict[str,) – An interaction
Return type:float
Returns:Likelihood of a passing outcome, given student and content parameters
assessment_pass_likelihoods(interactions)¶

Computes the likelihoods of passing a list of assessment interactions

Parameters:interactions (pd.DataFrame) – A dataframe containing rows of interactions
Return type:list[float]
Returns:Likelihoods of passing outcomes, given student and content parameters
class models.StudentBiasedCoinModel(history, filtered_history=None)¶

Class for simple skill model where students are modeled as biased coins that flip to pass/fail assessments

assessment_outcome_log_likelihood(interaction, outcome=None)¶

Compute log-likelihood of assessment interaction, given student pass rate

Parameters:
  • interaction (dict) – An interaction
  • outcome (bool|None) –

If outcome is a bool, it overrides interaction[‘outcome’]. This is useful for SkillModel.assessment_pass_likelihood

Return type:float
Returns:Log-likelihood of assessment result, given student pass rate
fit()¶

Estimate pass likelihood for each student

Uses Laplace smoothing

class models.TwoParameterLogisticModel(history, filtered_history=None, select_regularization_constant=False)¶

Class for two-parameter logistic item response theory (1PL IRT) model of binary response correctness

feature_matrix_from_interactions(df)¶

Construct sparse feature matrix for a set of assessment interactions

The feature vector for an interaction is a binary vector with values for each assessment (difficulty) and each student-assessment (proficiency & discriminability) pair

Parameters:df (pd.DataFrame) – A set of assessment interactions

:rtype scipy.sparse.csr_matrix :return A sparse array of dimensions [n_samples] X [n_features]
